gene.function: FUNCTION: Prevents inappropriate targeting of non-secretory polypeptides to the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). Binds to nascent polypeptide chains as they emerge from the ribosome and blocks their interaction with the signal recognition particle (SRP), which normally targets nascent secretory peptides to the ER. Also reduces the inherent affinity of ribosomes for protein translocation sites in the ER membrane (M sites). May act as a specific coactivator for JUN, binding to DNA and stabilizing the interaction of JUN homodimers with target gene promoters. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10982809, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15784678, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9877153}.
gene.subcellularLocation: SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm. Nucleus. Note=The heterodimer is located mainly in the cytosol, and the homodimer in the nucleus.
